RoyalTitleDef.label: Soldat
RoyalTitleDef.description: The faceless heart of the Reichswehr. They do not think; they obey. Each Soldat is a single cell in the Empire’s living machine—bred to conquer, trained to endure, and fated to die expanding Arellian borders.\n\nEquivalent to Private.

RoyalTitleDef.label: Gefreiter
RoyalTitleDef.description: A survivor of the first trials of war. A Gefreiter earns limited command, learning that victory is not courage, but discipline sharpened to a killing edge.\n\nEquivalent to Lance Corporal.

RoyalTitleDef.label: Obergefreiter
RoyalTitleDef.description: Veterans whose loyalty has been proven through repetition and attrition. Obergefreiters lead fireteams and ensure the line never bends, only advances.\n\nEquivalent to Corporal.

RoyalTitleDef.label: Unteroffizier
RoyalTitleDef.description: The Empire’s first instruments of control. Unteroffiziers shape Soldaten into extensions of their will, enforcing order through precision and fear of failure.\n\nEquivalent to Junior Sergeant.

RoyalTitleDef.label: Feldwebel
RoyalTitleDef.description: Commanders of squads and custodians of discipline. The Feldwebel ensures every shot fired, every march taken, aligns with the Empire’s purpose—unquestioned dominion.\n\nEquivalent to Sergeant.

RoyalTitleDef.label: Oberfeldwebel
RoyalTitleDef.description: Veterans whose presence steadies ranks. They lead not by inspiration but by the cold assurance that hesitation is treason.\n\nEquivalent to Senior Sergeant.

RoyalTitleDef.label: Stabsfeldwebel
RoyalTitleDef.description: Architects of endurance. The Stabsfeldwebel holds units together through exhaustion and attrition, ensuring the Empire’s momentum never falters.\n\nEquivalent to Master Sergeant.

RoyalTitleDef.label: Leutnant
RoyalTitleDef.description: Newly commissioned officers who carry the Empire’s voice into battle. Their duty is to learn that compassion is inefficiency and hesitation is defeat.\n\nEquivalent to Second Lieutenant.

RoyalTitleDef.label: Oberleutnant
RoyalTitleDef.description: Field commanders who translate doctrine into destruction. The Oberleutnant ensures that Imperial policy is written in the enemy’s blood and surrender.\n\nEquivalent to First Lieutenant.

RoyalTitleDef.label: Hauptmann
RoyalTitleDef.description: Commanders of companies and ship divisions. A Hauptmann is both strategist and executioner, balancing precision with calculated brutality.\n\nEquivalent to Captain.

RoyalTitleDef.label: Major
RoyalTitleDef.description: Planners of conquest. The Major shapes battlefields to the Empire’s favor, turning planetary resistance into logistical lessons for future wars.\n\nEquivalent to Major.

RoyalTitleDef.label: Oberst
RoyalTitleDef.description: Masters of systems and governors of destruction. The Oberst commands regiments and orbital fleets, ensuring no territory resists the Imperial standard twice.\n\nEquivalent to Colonel.

RoyalTitleDef.label: Admiralmajor
RoyalTitleDef.description: Strategic overseers of entire campaigns. The Admiralmajor directs divisions across worlds, reducing rebellion to memory and memory to ash.\n\nEquivalent to Rear Admiral.

RoyalTitleDef.label: Admiralleutnant
RoyalTitleDef.description: Controllers of sectors and planetary theaters. Admiralleutnants sculpt warfare as art—measured in orbital bombardments and surrendered populations.\n\nEquivalent to Vice Admiral.

RoyalTitleDef.label: Admiraloberst
RoyalTitleDef.description: High warlords of the Arellian frontier. They wield fleets and armies like instruments, their victories expanding the Empress’s reach across galaxies.\n\nEquivalent to Full Admiral.

RoyalTitleDef.label: Großadmiral
RoyalTitleDef.description: The pinnacle of mortal command. A Großadmiral carries the Empress’s mandate to subjugate the stars themselves. Their word redraws borders; their silence ends civilizations. Beneath them kneel fleets, armies, and worlds awaiting conquest.\n\nEquivalent to Grand Admiral.

RoyalTitleDef.label: Archgroßadmiral
RoyalTitleDef.description: The summit of the Arellian war hierarchy. The Archgroßadmiral does not command battles—they define them. Their authority extends beyond fleets and armies to the very doctrine of conquest itself. Where they turn their gaze, empires fall, and where they speak, entire sectors change allegiance. To bear this rank is to embody the Empire’s destiny to dominate the cosmos.\n\nEquivalent to Supreme Grand Admiral.

RoyalTitleDef.label: Empress
RoyalTitleDef.description: Once the insurgent commander who shattered the Matanni Dominion, the Empress rose from rebellion to empire, forging unity through fire and precision. Her victory over the overlords is immortalized as the First Conquest—proof that strength, not birthright, defines sovereignty. Under her reign, the Arellian banners became the measure of civilization itself, and every new world is judged by its willingness to kneel.\n\nFounder and Supreme Sovereign of the Arellian Empire.
